This operation allows users to retrieve a filtered and paginated list of their subscriptions from the subscription_renewal_guardian_subscriptions table.

Users may specify search criteria in the request body such as filtering by status (ACTIVE, PAUSED, CANCELED), vendor, plan name, or date ranges for next_renewal_at. Pagination is supported via standard limit and offset parameters.

Security considerations ensure only the authenticated user's subscriptions are returned unless the requester has admin role with read-only access to all users' subscriptions.

The response returns a paginated list of subscription summaries with essential properties for display in UI lists.

This operation is critical for enabling users to manage and monitor their subscriptions efficiently.

Parameters:
- No path parameters.

Request Body:
- ISubscriptionRenewalGuardianSubscriptions.IRequest: search, filter, pagination parameters.

Response Body:
- IPageISubscriptionRenewalGuardianSubscriptions.ISummary: paginated subscription summaries.

Authorization:
- Roles: user, admin (both can access but with data filtering logic).

Expected errors:
- 401 Unauthorized if unauthenticated.
- 400 Bad Request for invalid filters.
operations.summary: Search and retrieve paginated list of subscriptions

requestBody.description: Search criteria and pagination parameters for subscriptions

responseBody.description: Paginated list of subscription summaries matching search criteria

operations.name: index

operations.specification:
This operation retrieves detailed information about a single subscription identified by its subscriptionId. It fetches the subscription record from the subscription_renewal_guardian_subscriptions table, including related vendor and reminder settings. This allows users to view all details of their subscription and related configuration.

Security ensures that ordinary users can access only their own subscriptions, while admin users have read-only access to any user's subscription.

Parameters:
- subscriptionId (string, UUID): unique identifier of the subscription to fetch.

Response:
- ISubscriptionRenewalGuardianSubscription: Full subscription details including relations.

Authorization Roles:
- user, admin (with appropriate data filtering).

Errors:
- 401 Unauthorized, 404 Not Found if subscription does not exist or access denied.
operations.description:
Retrieve detailed information of a subscription by its ID.

This operation fetches the subscription identified by subscriptionId from the subscription_renewal_guardian_subscriptions table.
It includes comprehensive details such as plan name, status, billing cycle, renewal dates, amount, currency, notes, and related vendor and reminder settings.

Security ensures that only the owner user or an admin can access the subscription details.

Path Parameters:
- subscriptionId: UUID of the subscription to retrieve.

This operation is essential for viewing full subscription details in a dedicated UI screen.
operations.summary: Retrieve detailed subscription information by ID

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the subscription to retrieve

responseBody.description: Subscription detailed information

operations.name: at

operations.specification:
This operation retrieves detailed information about a single subscription identified by its subscriptionId. It fetches the subscription record from the subscription_renewal_guardian_subscriptions table, including related vendor and reminder settings. This allows users to view all details of their subscription and related configuration.

Security ensures that ordinary users can access only their own subscriptions, while admin users have read-only access to any user's subscription.

Parameters:
- subscriptionId (string, UUID): unique identifier of the subscription to fetch.

Response:
- ISubscriptionRenewalGuardianSubscription: Full subscription details including relations.

Authorization Roles:
- user, admin (with appropriate data filtering).

Errors:
- 401 Unauthorized, 404 Not Found if subscription does not exist or access denied.
operations.description:
Retrieve detailed information of a subscription by its ID.

This operation fetches the subscription identified by subscriptionId from the subscription_renewal_guardian_subscriptions table.
It includes comprehensive details such as plan name, status, billing cycle, renewal dates, amount, currency, notes, and related vendor and reminder settings.

Security ensures that only the owner user or an admin can access the subscription details.

Path Parameters:
- subscriptionId: UUID of the subscription to retrieve.

This operation is essential for viewing full subscription details in a dedicated UI screen.
operations.summary: Retrieve detailed subscription information by ID

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the subscription to retrieve

responseBody.description: Subscription detailed information

operations.name: at

operations.specification:
This operation creates a new subscription record for the authenticated user. It saves data to the subscription_renewal_guardian_subscriptions table ensuring all business rules:
- Enforces uniqueness on (user_id, vendor_id, plan_name) to prevent duplicates.
- Automatically calculates and persists next_renewal_at by advancing started_at by billing_cycle intervals until strictly greater than current time.
- Validates all fields including billing_cycle ENUM values (DAILY, WEEKLY, MONTHLY, YEARLY), status values (ACTIVE, PAUSED, CANCELED), and currency FORMAT.

Request Body:
- ISubscriptionRenewalGuardianSubscription.ICreate: Contains all required data to create subscription except id, created_at, updated_at (system-generated).

Response Body:
- ISubscriptionRenewalGuardianSubscription: The newly created subscription with all persisted fields.

Authorization:
- user role only, as only authenticated users can create their subscriptions.

Errors:
- 400 Bad Request for validation failures.
- 409 Conflict for uniqueness violations.
- 401 Unauthorized if unauthenticated.
operations.description:
Create a new subscription for the authenticated user.

This operation accepts subscription creation data, validates it against business rules, and stores the new subscription in the database.
It calculates the next_renewal_at field automatically from started_at and billing_cycle according to the business logic.

Uniqueness constraints on (user_id, vendor_id, plan_name) are enforced.

Only authenticated users with user role can create subscriptions.

No soft delete mechanisms apply; this is a hard create operation.

Request Body:
- subscription creation data as ISubscriptionRenewalGuardianSubscription.ICreate.

Response Body:
- Newly created subscription including calculated fields.

Path Parameters:
- None.

Security:
- Authentication and ownership verified by JWT.

This operation is core to user subscription lifecycle management.
operations.summary: Create a new subscription

requestBody.description: Subscription creation data

responseBody.description: Newly created subscription information

operations.name: create

operations.specification:
This operation updates an existing subscription identified by subscriptionId.

It updates fields visible in the IUpdate DTO, validates changes according to business rules, and recalculates next_renewal_at if billing_cycle, started_at, or status changed.

Modifications are only allowed if the subscription status is not CANCELED, which is terminal and read-only.

Path Parameters:
- subscriptionId (UUID): ID of the subscription to update.

Request Body:
- ISubscriptionRenewalGuardianSubscription.IUpdate: Fields to update.

Response Body:
- The updated subscription record including recalculated fields.

Authorization Roles:
- user (owner) only. Admin has read-only access and cannot update.

Errors:
- 400 Bad Request for validation errors.
- 409 Conflict if update violates business constraints.
- 403 Forbidden if subscription is CANCELED.
- 401 Unauthorized if unauthenticated.
operations.description:
Update an existing subscription identified by subscriptionId.

Allows modification of subscription fields except primary key and immutable fields.
Validates input and business rules, recalculates next_renewal_at if necessary.

Updates are forbidden on CANCELED subscriptions to enforce terminal state.

Path Parameters:
- subscriptionId: UUID of the subscription to update.

Request Body:
- ISubscriptionRenewalGuardianSubscription.IUpdate containing fields to update.

Response Body:
- Updated subscription details.

Authorization ensures only the owner user can update their subscription.

This enables users to maintain their subscription information accurately throughout its lifecycle.
operations.summary: Update subscription by ID

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the subscription to update

requestBody.description: Subscription update data

responseBody.description: Updated subscription information

operations.name: update

operations.specification: This operation deletes a specific subscription from the subscription_renewal_guardian_subscriptions table. It permanently removes the subscription record identified by subscriptionId UUID. Access is restricted to authenticated users with the 'user' role to delete their own subscriptions. No request body or response body is involved. This action cascades deletions to related reminders as per DB constraints.
operations.description:
Delete a subscription identified by subscriptionId. Only authorized users with role 'user' can perform this operation. The subscription identified by UUID subscriptionId is removed permanently from the system.

This operation requires no request body and produces no response body.

HTTP 404 returned if subscription not found or user unauthorized.
HTTP 401 returned if user not authenticated.
operations.summary: Delete a subscription by ID

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: UUID of the subscription to delete

operations.name: erase

operations.specification: This operation retrieves a pageable list of reminder settings for a given subscription from subscription_renewal_guardian_reminder_settings table. Users with 'user' role can list reminder settings for their own subscription identified by subscriptionId. Supports pagination and filtering according to request body schema ISubscriptionRenewalGuardianReminderSetting.IRequest. Response includes paginated summary of reminders.
operations.description:
List reminder settings linked to subscription identified by subscriptionId. Supports pagination and filtering.

Available only to users with 'user' authorization role for their own subscriptions.

Returns paginated summaries of reminder settings.

Request body specifies filtering and pagination parameters.
operations.summary: List reminder settings for subscription

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: UUID of the subscription

requestBody.description: Filter and pagination parameters for reminder settings query

responseBody.description: Paginated list of reminder settings

operations.name: index

operations.specification: This operation retrieves detailed information of a specific reminder setting identified by reminderSettingId under a subscription subscriptionId from subscription_renewal_guardian_reminder_settings. Authorized users with 'user' role can access only their own reminder settings. Response includes full reminder setting entity.
operations.description:
Get detailed reminder setting identified by reminderSettingId for subscription identified by subscriptionId.

Accessible to users with 'user' authorization role only.

Returns full reminder setting data.

HTTP 404 if reminder not found. HTTP 401 for unauthorized access.
operations.summary: Get reminder setting details by ID

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: UUID of the subscription

parameters.name: reminderSettingId
parameters.description: UUID of the reminder setting

responseBody.description: Reminder setting details

operations.name: at

operations.specification: This operation creates a new reminder setting for a subscription in subscription_renewal_guardian_reminder_settings table. Requires subscriptionId as path parameter and request body with days_before and channel fields. Enforces uniqueness on subscription_id and days_before. Accessible only to authenticated users with 'user' role. Response returns the created reminder setting entity.
operations.description:
Create a new reminder setting for a subscription specified by subscriptionId.

Input request body includes days_before and channel.

Accessible only by users with 'user' role.

Returns the created reminder setting entity.

Validation enforces uniqueness on (subscription_id, days_before).

Errors include validation failure or unique constraint violation.
operations.summary: Create a new reminder setting

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: UUID of the subscription

requestBody.description: Reminder setting creation data

responseBody.description: Created reminder setting entity

operations.name: create

operations.specification: This operation updates a specific reminder setting attached to a subscription in the SubscriptionRenewalGuardian system. It works on the subscription_renewal_guardian_reminder_settings table, uniquely identified by reminderSettingId path parameter and scoped by subscriptionId. The update request allows clients to modify days_before and channel attributes which determine the timing and method of renewal reminders. The system enforces business rules such as uniqueness of days_before per subscription and valid channel values 'EMAIL' or 'NONE'. This operation requires authentication with role 'user' since reminders belong to users' subscriptions.
operations.description:
This PUT operation updates the reminder setting for a subscription. It requires both subscriptionId and reminderSettingId to identify the exact reminder setting to be updated.

The reminder setting consists of the number of days before renewal when a reminder should be sent, and the communication channel which can be either EMAIL or NONE.

Only authenticated users with role 'user' are authorized to update reminder settings linked to their own subscriptions.

The system maintains uniqueness on the combination of subscription and days_before to prevent duplicate reminders. Updates must comply with these constraints.

If successful, the updated reminder setting details are returned. Validation errors, authorization failures, or uniqueness conflicts are appropriately handled.
operations.summary: Update a reminder setting for a subscription

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: Target subscription's ID

parameters.name: reminderSettingId
parameters.description: Target reminder setting's ID

requestBody.description: Updated reminder setting information

responseBody.description: Updated reminder setting details

operations.name: updateReminderSetting

operations.specification:
This operation deletes a specific reminder setting associated with a subscription in the SubscriptionRenewalGuardian system. It targets the subscription_renewal_guardian_reminder_settings table uniquely identified by the reminderSettingId path parameter and scoped by the subscriptionId path parameter. This hard delete operation completely removes the reminder setting from the database, permanently freeing the associated combination of subscription and days_before to allow future re-creation.

Only authenticated users with role 'user' are authorized to delete their own reminder settings. No request body is needed as the operation is a straightforward delete by ID.

Successful operation yields no response body. Authorization, validation, and not found errors are handled appropriately.
operations.description:
This DELETE operation removes a reminder setting for a subscription permanently. Both subscriptionId and reminderSettingId must be specified for precise targeting.

Only users with 'user' role may delete their own reminder settings.

No request body is required.

Upon success, no content is returned.

Errors such as unauthorized access or missing resources are handled with appropriate HTTP status codes.
operations.summary: Delete a reminder setting for a subscription

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: Target subscription's ID

parameters.name: reminderSettingId
parameters.description: Target reminder setting's ID

operations.name: eraseReminderSetting

operations.specification:
This operation lists upcoming active subscription renewals for the authenticated user within a configurable date range, defaulting to 30 days. It filters subscriptions from the subscription_renewal_guardian_subscriptions table with status ACTIVE, excluding PAUSED or CANCELED. It supports pagination via limit and offset query parameters and sorts results ascending by next_renewal_at.

The endpoint enables users to manage and be aware of their subscription renewals proactively. Only authenticated users with role 'user' can access this listing.

The request body enables specifying filtering criteria such as date ranges or pagination.

The response delivers a paginated list of subscription summaries matching the criteria.
operations.description:
This PATCH operation retrieves a paginated list of upcoming active subscription renewals for the authenticated user.

The listing excludes subscriptions with status PAUSED or CANCELED to focus on actionable renewals.

Pagination parameters limit and offset control the returned data volume.

The service requires authentication with role 'user' to ensure users only see their own subscriptions.

This endpoint is essential for providing renewal notifications and subscription management UI components.

Errors like unauthorized access or invalid parameters produce appropriate HTTP error responses.
operations.summary: List upcoming active subscription renewals with pagination

requestBody.description: Search criteria and pagination parameters for upcoming renewals

responseBody.description: Paginated list of upcoming active subscription renewals

operations.name: indexUpcomingRenewals

authorization.name: user
authorization.description: Authenticated standard user who can manage their own subscription data.

authorization.name: admin
authorization.description: Read-only administrator who can view all users' records in the system.

authorization.name: guest
authorization.description: Unauthenticated user who can register and login.

limit.description: Limitation of records per a page.

pages.description:
Total pages.

Equal to {@link records} / {@link limit} with ceiling.

access.description:
JWT access token for authenticated requests.

This token should be included in the Authorization header for subsequent
authenticated API requests as `Bearer {token}`.

refresh.description:
Refresh token for obtaining new access tokens.

This token can be used to request new access tokens when the current access
token expires, extending the user's session.

expired_at.description:
Access token expiration timestamp.

ISO 8601 date-time string indicating when the access token will expire and
can no longer be used for authentication.

refreshable_until.description:
Refresh token expiration timestamp.

ISO 8601 date-time string indicating the latest time until which the
refresh token can be used to obtain new access tokens.

IAuthorizationToken.description:
Authorization token response structure.

This interface defines the structure of the authorization token response
returned after successful user authentication. It contains both access and
refresh tokens along with their expiration information.

This token structure is automatically included in API schemas when the system
detects authorization roles in the requirements analysis phase. It provides a
standard format for JWT-based authentication across the generated backend
applications.

IPageISubscriptionRenewalGuardianUser.description:
A page.

Collection of records with pagination information.

IPageISubscriptionRenewalGuardianAdmin.I.description:
A page.

Collection of records with pagination information.

IPageISubscriptionRenewalGuardianGuest.I.description:
A page.

Collection of records with pagination information.

IPageISubscriptionRenewalGuardianVendors.description:
A page.

Collection of records with pagination information.

IPageISubscriptionRenewalGuardianSubscri.description:
A page.

Collection of records with pagination information.

IPageISubscriptionRenewalGuardianReminde.description:
A page.

Collection of records with pagination information.

IPageISubscriptionRenewalGuardianSubscri.description:
A page.

Collection of records with pagination information.

email.description: Unique email address for the user.

password.description: User's plaintext password to be hashed securely.

ISubscriptionRenewalGuardianUser.IJoin.description: Request body for registering a new user account. Includes mandatory email and plaintext password for join process. Password will be hashed on server side.

ISubscriptionRenewalGuardianUser.ILogin.description: Request body for login operation with email and password.

refresh_token.description: Refresh token string issued at login or join.

ISubscriptionRenewalGuardianUser.IRefres.description: Request body for token refresh operation. Typically includes the refresh token.

id.description: Unique identifier of the authenticated user.

email.description:
User's unique email address used for login and identification.

Must be unique across all users.

password_hash.description:
Hashed password for secure authentication.

NEVER included in response types for security.

created_at.description:
Timestamp when the user account was created.

Stored as UTC ISO 8601 string.

updated_at.description:
Timestamp when the user account was last updated.

Stored as UTC ISO 8601 string.

ISubscriptionRenewalGuardianUser.IAuthor.description: Response body for authorization containing user id and token info. Provides the authenticated user's unique identifier and an authorization token object (e.g., JWT).

id.description:
Primary Key.

Unique identifier of the admin account.

email.description:
Administrator's unique email address.

Must be a unique string.

password_hash.description:
Hashed password string for admin authentication.

Stored securely and never exposed.

created_at.description:
Timestamp of account creation.

Stored as ISO8601 string.

updated_at.description:
Timestamp of last account update.

Stored as ISO8601 string.

ISubscriptionRenewalGuardianAdmin.description:
Admin accounts with read-only access to all users subscription data.
Includes login credentials and audit timestamps.

Primary key is UUID \`id\`.

Email must be unique across admins.

ISubscriptionRenewalGuardianAdmin.ICreat.description: Payload to create a new SubscriptionRenewalGuardianAdmin account.

password.description: Password in plain text sent from client, to be hashed and compared in backend.

refresh_token.description: Refresh token string to obtain a new access token.

id.description: Unique identifier of the authenticated admin user.

email.description:
Administrator's unique email address.

Must be a unique string.

password_hash.description:
Hashed password string for admin authentication.

Stored securely and never exposed.

created_at.description:
Timestamp of account creation.

Stored as ISO8601 string.

updated_at.description:
Timestamp of last account update.

Stored as ISO8601 string.

ISubscriptionRenewalGuardianAdmin.IAutho.description: Authorization response containing JWT token for administrator.

ISubscriptionRenewalGuardianGuest.ICreat.description:
Guest user account creation payload.

Contains guest email address for registration.

Required for creating a guest user record.

Email must be valid.

created_at.description: Timestamp when the guest record was created.

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the guest record was last updated.

ISubscriptionRenewalGuardianGuest.IAutho.description:
Authorization response containing JWT token for guest user.

Returned after successful authentication or join operations.

refresh_token.description: Refresh token string used to renew authorization.

ISubscriptionRenewalGuardianGuest.IRefre.description:
Request payload for refreshing JWT tokens using refresh token.

Refresh token is required for authentication renewal.

limit.description: Number of items per page limit.

email.description: Filter guests by email substring or exact match.

ISubscriptionRenewalGuardianGuest.IReque.description: Request parameters for filtering and paginating guest user list.

limit.description:
Limitation of records per a page.

@default 100

search_email.description: Email address filter. Exact or partial match for user emails.

search_created_before.description: Filter to match users created before this DateTime (ISO 8601 format).

search_created_after.description: Filter to match users created after this DateTime (ISO 8601 format).

ISubscriptionRenewalGuardianUser.IReques.description: Request parameters for listing users with pagination and optional filtering.

id.description:
Primary Key.

UUID string to uniquely identify the user account.

email.description:
User's unique email address used for login and identification.

Must be unique across all users.

password_hash.description:
Hashed password for secure authentication.

NEVER included in response types for security.

created_at.description:
Timestamp when the user account was created.

Stored as UTC ISO 8601 string.

updated_at.description:
Timestamp when the user account was last updated.

Stored as UTC ISO 8601 string.

email.description:
User's unique email address.

Required for user registration.

password_hash.description:
Plain text password to be hashed securely before storage.

Must follow password complexity policies.

ISubscriptionRenewalGuardianUser.ICreate.description:
Request body for creating a new subscription renewal guardian user account.

Includes required email and hashed password fields for registration.

Passwords must be properly hashed before storage.

email.description:
User's unique email address.

Optional for update; if provided, must remain unique.

password_hash.description:
New hashed password.

Optional for update.
Must be properly hashed before storing.

updated_at.description:
The last time the user was updated.

Optional and readonly; usually set by the system.

ISubscriptionRenewalGuardianUser.IUpdate.description:
Request body for updating an existing subscription renewal guardian user account.

All fields optional; password hash and email can be updated with proper validations.

The updated_at timestamp is managed by the system and is optional.

limit.description: Limitation of records per a page.

ISubscriptionRenewalGuardianAdmin.IReque.description: Request to search and filter SubscriptionRenewalGuardianAdmin accounts.

email.description:
Unique email address to update for the admin.

Optional, must be unique if provided.

password_hash.description:
Password hash string for updating admin password.

Optional, stored securely.

ISubscriptionRenewalGuardianAdmin.IUpdat.description:
Properties used to update an admin user account.
All fields are optional to allow partial updates.

id.description:
Primary Key.

Unique identifier of the guest user.

created_at.description: Timestamp when the guest record was created.

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the guest record was last updated.

ISubscriptionRenewalGuardianGuest.description:
Guest users are unauthenticated visitors who can register and login.
This table tracks guest registration attempts or temporary data as needed.

Primary key is UUID \`id\`.

Created and updated timestamps for record maintenance.

email.description: Guest user's email address. Must be a valid email format.

ISubscriptionRenewalGuardianGuest.IUpdat.description: Update of guest user details. Allowed to modify email and timestamps updated_at.

name.description: Partial name filter for vendor search. Nullable string.

include_deleted.description: Flag whether to include soft-deleted vendors. Nullable boolean.

ISubscriptionRenewalGuardianVendors.IReq.description: Vendor search request with pagination and filters.

id.description:
Unique identifier (UUID) of the vendor.

This ID is the primary key for the subscription renewal guardian vendors.

name.description:
Unique vendor name, e.g., Netflix or Spotify.

This field is used for identifying the subscription service provider.
Must be unique across all vendors.

created_at.description:
Timestamp when the vendor record was created.

Stored in UTC with time zone.

updated_at.description:
Timestamp when the vendor was last updated.

Stored in UTC with time zone.

deleted_at.description:
Optional timestamp indicating when the record was soft deleted.

Null if the vendor is active.

ISubscriptionRenewalGuardianVendors.description:
Vendor entity representing subscription service providers.

Includes unique name and timestamps.

Supports soft deletion via deleted_at.

ISubscriptionRenewalGuardianVendors.ICre.description: Vendor creation input. Requires unique name.

name.description: Unique name of the vendor. Must be unique and non-empty.

ISubscriptionRenewalGuardianVendors.IUpd.description: Vendor update schema. You can update vendor's name only.

next_renewal_from.description: Filter by minimum next renewal date.

next_renewal_to.description: Filter by maximum next renewal date.

limit.description: Pagination parameter: limit of records per page.

ISubscriptionRenewalGuardianSubscription.description: Request schema for filtering subscription list with pagination.

plan_name.description: Name of the subscription plan. Unique per user and vendor.

currency.description: Currency code following ISO 4217 3-letter uppercase format.

started_at.description: Subscription start date in UTC ISO 8601 format.

next_renewal_at.description: Next scheduled renewal date in UTC ISO 8601 format.

created_at.description: Record creation timestamp in UTC ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Record last update timestamp in UTC ISO 8601 format.

plan_name.description: Name of the subscription plan. Unique per user and vendor.

currency.description: Currency code following ISO 4217 3-letter uppercase format.

started_at.description: Subscription start date in UTC ISO 8601 format.

plan_name.description: Name of the subscription plan. Unique per user and vendor. Nullable for updates.

billing_cycle.description: Billing cycle interval. Allowed values: DAILY, WEEKLY, MONTHLY, YEARLY. Nullable for updates.

amount.description: Subscription amount, must be >= 0. Nullable for updates.

currency.description: Currency code following ISO 4217 3-letter uppercase format. Nullable for updates.

started_at.description: Subscription start date in UTC ISO 8601 format. Nullable for updates.

next_renewal_at.description: Next scheduled renewal date in UTC ISO 8601 format. Calculated by advancing started_at by billing cycle intervals until strictly greater than current time. Nullable for updates.

status.description: Subscription status. Allowed values: ACTIVE, PAUSED, CANCELED. Nullable for updates.

notes.description: Optional notes about the subscription. Nullable for updates.

ISubscriptionRenewalGuardianSubscription.description: Update object for subscriptionRenewalGuardianSubscription. Partial and fields nullable for updates.

subscription_id.description: Referenced subscription ID for filtering reminder settings. Nullable.

days_before.description: Days before renewal to filter reminder settings. Allowed values: 7, 3, 1. Nullable.

channel.description: Reminder communication channel to filter. Allowed values: EMAIL, NONE. Nullable.

limit.description: Pagination limit for list size. Nullable.

offset.description: Pagination offset for list start. Nullable.

ISubscriptionRenewalGuardianReminderSett.description: Request query for subscriptionRenewalGuardianReminderSetting for filtering and pagination.

oneOf.description: Number of days before the subscription renewal to send the reminder. Allowed values are 7, 3, or 1.
Number of days before the subscription renewal to send the reminder. Allowed values are 7, 3, or 1.
Number of days before the subscription renewal to send the reminder. Allowed values are 7, 3, or 1.

days_before.description: Number of days before the subscription renewal to send the reminder. Allowed values are 7, 3, or 1.

oneOf.description: Communication channel for reminders. Allowed values are 'EMAIL' or 'NONE'.
Communication channel for reminders. Allowed values are 'EMAIL' or 'NONE'.

channel.description: Communication channel for reminders. Allowed values are 'EMAIL' or 'NONE'.

created_at.description: Timestamp when the reminder setting was created.

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the reminder setting was last updated.

deleted_at.description: Timestamp when the reminder setting was soft deleted. Null if not deleted.

ISubscriptionRenewalGuardianReminderSett.description: Reminder settings attached to subscriptions for renewal notifications. Each setting defines how many days before renewal to notify and via which channel. Uniqueness enforced on subscription and days_before. Supports created_at, updated_at, and soft delete timestamps.

oneOf.description: Number of days before the subscription renewal to send the reminder. Allowed values are 7, 3, or 1.
Number of days before the subscription renewal to send the reminder. Allowed values are 7, 3, or 1.
Number of days before the subscription renewal to send the reminder. Allowed values are 7, 3, or 1.

days_before.description: Number of days before the subscription renewal to send the reminder. Allowed values are 7, 3, or 1.

oneOf.description: Communication channel for reminders. Allowed values are 'EMAIL' or 'NONE'.
Communication channel for reminders. Allowed values are 'EMAIL' or 'NONE'.

channel.description: Communication channel for reminders. Allowed values are 'EMAIL' or 'NONE'.

ISubscriptionRenewalGuardianReminderSett.description: Create request for subscriptionRenewalGuardianReminderSetting. Requires subscription_id, days_before, and channel.

days_before.description:
Number of days before the subscription renewal to send the reminder.

Allowed values are 7, 3, or 1.

channel.description:
Communication channel for reminders.

Allowed values are 'EMAIL' or 'NONE'.

deleted_at.description: Timestamp when the reminder setting was soft deleted. Null if not deleted.

ISubscriptionRenewalGuardianReminderSett.description:
Partial update for reminder settings.

All properties are optional except none are omitted
- Use null explicitly for fields that need to be reset.

Allows users to modify reminder trigger days, channel, or soft deletion.

limit.description: Limit of records per page, optional.

ISubscriptionRenewalGuardianSubscription.description: Request parameters for upcoming renewals listing including optional pagination.

id.description: Unique identifier of the admin account

email.description: Unique email address of the admin

ISubscriptionRenewalGuardianAdmin.ISumma.description: Summary representation of an admin account with essential non-sensitive fields.

id.description: Unique identifier of the guest user account

email.description: Email address of the guest user

ISubscriptionRenewalGuardianGuest.ISumma.description: Summary representation of a guest user with essential identification fields.

ISubscriptionRenewalGuardianVendors.ISum.description: Summary view of a vendor containing essential identification fields.

billing_cycle.description: Billing cycle of the subscription. One of DAILY, WEEKLY, MONTHLY, or YEARLY.

next_renewal_at.description: Next scheduled renewal date in UTC ISO 8601 format.

ISubscriptionRenewalGuardianSubscription.description: Summary view of subscription for listing and brief info.

id.description: Unique identifier of the reminder setting.

days_before.description: Number of days before renewal to send this reminder.

ISubscriptionRenewalGuardianReminderSett.description: Summary of reminder settings with timing and channel.

next_renewal_at.description: Next renewal date/time in ISO8601 UTC.

amount.description: Subscription amount, greater or equal to 0.

ISubscriptionRenewalGuardianSubscription.description: Detailed summary of subscription with key fields for UI.
